metadata.Title: CVE-2022-41973 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
multipath-tools 0.7.7 through 0.9.x before 0.9.2 allows local users to obtain root access, as exploited in conjunction with CVE-2022-41974. Local users able to access /dev/shm can change symlinks in multipathd due to incorrect symlink handling, which could lead to controlled file writes outside of the /dev/shm directory. This could be used indirectly for local privilege escalation to root.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41973` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

kpartx - 0.8.8-1ubuntu1.22.04.1
kpartx-boot - 0.8.8-1ubuntu1.22.04.1
multipath-tools - 0.8.8-1ubuntu1.22.04.1
multipath-tools-boot - 0.8.8-1ubuntu1.22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> introduced in version 0.7.7 via commit 65d0a63

criterions.comment: multipath-tools package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8.8-1ubuntu1.22.04.1').
